items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: This message has been issued, because some minor flooding to riverside roads and footpaths is likely this morning and into the afternoon. Water levels continue to remain high. This is due to a natural tide locking effect. High tidal water moving up the rivers from Great Yarmouth, is currently restricting the normal drainage out to sea at low tide, of the Broads river system. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry road in Horning. Flood water is dangerous. Don't put yourself or others at risk. We are monitoring the situation and are not expecting the situation to escalate. We will update this message by 10am tomorrow, Monday 6th December 2021.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Marchington Brook, Picknall Brook, Rolleston Brook

items.message: River levels remain high as a result of recent rainfall. Consequently, flooding of property, roads and farmland is possible today Monday 06/12/2021. Areas most at risk are low lying land around the River Rye and its tributaries, including Ralsdale Beck, River Seph, Ledge Beck, Fangdale Beck, Prodale Beck, Ladhill Beck, Etton Gill, Borough Beck and Spittle Beck. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the forecast. Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  This message will be updated on Monday afternoon, 06/12/2021, or as the situation changes.
The flood alert for the North Sea coast at Bridlington has been removed. The situation is improving and no further flooding is expected in this area.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Sandyford Brook, Ridings Brook, Saredon Brook

items.message: River levels are rising at the Milford river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall last night. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected tonight into tomorrow, Monday, 06/12/21. Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Sow between Great Bridgeford and Shugborough, the River Penk between Coven and Stafford, the Sandyford Brook, the Rising Brook, the Ridings Brook and the Saredon Brook. No further rainfall is forecast. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast. Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, Monday, 06/12/21, or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Willington Cableway and Shardlow river gauges as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected tonight, 05/12/21.  Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Willington, Barrow upon Trent, Swarkestone, Bargate Lane, and the access roads to Willington Meadows, the Twyford Village access road, Church Lane at Barrow, and Ingleby Lane. We expect river levels to continue to rise during tonight. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses. This message will be updated tomorrow afternoon, 06/12/21, or as the situation changes.
River levels on the River Riccal have fallen below the levels of concern. We continue to monitor the situation. Please check the .GOV website for up to date information for the next 5 days.

River levels remain high at the Hints river gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall over the weekend. Consequently, the risk of flooding of roads and farmland remains overnight into Monday morning, 06/12/21.
Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the Bourne Brook.   
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated Tomorrow morning, 06/12/21 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high at the Aston Bridge and Marston on Dove river gauges as a result of heavy rainfall last night. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected overnight through to Monday, 06/12/21. Flooding is expected to affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Dove between Rocester and Clay Mills. No further rainfall is forecast. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast. Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated tomorrow morning 06/12/21, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Derwent, Sea Cut, River Hertford, Burniston Beck

items.message: The flood alert for the Upper River Derwent has been reissued as levels are now starting to rise again following rainfall over the weekend. River levels are forecast to rise slowly through Monday and into Tuesday, and are then expected to return to levels similar to those seen on Friday 3 December. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today, Monday, 06/12/2021 and on Tuesday 07/12/2021. Further rainfall is forecast and river levels could remain high until later in the week. Areas most at risk are low lying land and roads. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the forecast. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses, and do not walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated on Monday afternoon, 06/12/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Wyre estuary from Fleetwood and Knott End to Little Eccleston
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been issued due to the high tide forecast at 12:15 PM on Monday 06/12/2021.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected between 11:00 AM and 01:30 PM on Monday 06/12/2021.

No flooding of properties is expected.

Further flood alerts may be issued as part of this high spring tide cycle which lasts until Wednesday 08/12/2021. 

Avoid footpaths along the coastline and estuary. Take care planning driving routes to coastal roads, which may be flooded.

This Flood Alert has been issued due to the high tide forecast at 12:20pm on 06/12/2021. Flooding is possible 2 hours either side of this time.
Tides are expected to be higher than usual due to the forecast weather conditions during spring tides.
The forecast is for strong winds throughout day. This may cause large waves and spray overtopping on the coast.
We do not expect to see similar impacts for this evening's high tides but forecasts indicate further alerts may be issued Tuesday through to Wednesday. 
Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.

items.description: Tidal River Avon at Bristol, Pill and Shirehampton

floodArea.county: City of Bristol, North Somerset, South Gloucestershire

items.message:
A large tidal surge is expected with possible overtopping and onshore flooding as a result of high water levels. The time and date of the forecast high water is 08:15am on 06/12/2021. The forecast tide level is 7.38 m AOD. The forecast wind strength and direction is Force 5 in a Southerly direction. There is a possibility of flooding for the tidal River Avon from Sea Mills to Conham, and between the Avonmouth Bridge and Shirehamption Park, including Pill and Shirehampton, however conditions may apply one/two hours either side of the high tide.
Monday (6th December) evening’s tide are not expected to reach Flood Alert criteria but Tuesday (7th December) tides are forecast to reach flood alert criteria, so this flood alert will remain in place. This message will up dated on Monday (6th December) afternoon.
Our operation teams are closing flood gates in the Pill and Shirehampton area. 
Be careful along beaches, promenades and coastal footpaths and roads. 
Please note all tide times are in local time and are using the 24 hour clock and refer to the high water time at Avonmouth.

items.message: This message has been issued, because some minor flooding to riverside roads and footpaths is likely this morning and into the afternoon. Water levels continue to remain high. This is due to a natural tide locking effect. High tidal water moving up the rivers from Great Yarmouth, is currently restricting the normal drainage out to sea at low tide, of the Broads river system. We expect to see high water levels in Brundall and Reedham riverside areas. Flood water is dangerous. Don't put yourself or others at risk. We are monitoring the situation and are not expecting the situation to escalate. We will update this message by 10am tomorrow, Monday 6th December 2021.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.
The forecast continues to be unsettled over the next 24 hours. River levels remain high but are beginning to fall. 
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Please continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.
